The bard shakes his head glumly and says, "Signed: Bracaduun."

You know the stories about the torture of magicians and you don"t doubt that they are true.  But looking at the faces of the people gathered here, waiting for your answer, you know you can"t show your true feelings.

So you smile and take the bird in your hands.  You slowly lift the animal to your face and brush your lips against its head.

"I"m glad I"ll have the chance to get close to these mages," you say.  "Then they will know that the weak don"t live long when they fall into my hands."
map.hc1_main:1.event.6.description:
Once again, you have to thank the bards for their knowledge.

There once lived in these parts a barbarian woman who was married to an ogre.  She took her dowry and went to the ogre"s hut, but when the giant left, she grabbed his ax and beheaded him.  It is said that she hid the dowry in a nearby cave and spent the rest of her life alone in the ogre"s hut that was to be her home.

Using clues from this old fairy tale, the bards found a chest of resources buried in a mountain cave.
map.hc1_main:1.event.7.description: "Don"t forget to recruit troops in places like the goblin barracks each week," reminds Hardac, my advisor.  "The more troops you have, the more powerful you are!"
map.hc1_main:1.event.8.description: Fograr, one of your most experienced captains, advises you to gather all the troops under your command.  Thanks to this, they will protect you from the mages hunting you, and you will be able to attack using both their numbers and their will to fight.
map.hc1_main:1.event.9.description:
A lone, bloody goblin returns from a scouting mission with terrible news.  Fograr, your best captain, was ambushed by magicians.  Only the goblin managed to escape, although he witnessed Fograr"s brutal execution.  The captain didn"t even have a chance to defend himself!

What a terrible death to be caught by magic and unable to defend yourself!  These magicians have no sense of shame or honor.  You tighten your grip on the hilt of your sword, wishing that one of these spellcasters would be next to you at that moment.  If only you could take revenge on these cowards!
map.hc1_main:1.guards.9.28.0.message: This is an important building for every city, because even a small fragment of it attracts visitors.  And more visitors mean more recruits!
map.hc1_main:2.event.0.description:
Kurl chose the site for his fortress well.  This rugged terrain is difficult to traverse, and several important crossings have been blocked by uncaring border guards.  Find keykeepers" tents in the same colors as the border gates. And you better hurry.

Since Kurl has announced that he will kill the bards within three months, if the barbarian king does not disperse his troops and surrender, the morale of your troops will decline.  You have been repeating for months how important bards are to the history and national identity of barbarians.  So what happens if the bards die?

If you don"t release them within three months, you"ll have the opportunity to find out.
map.hc1_main:2.event.1.description:
"You shouldn"t bother gathering resources and troops, my king," says one of the captains.

"We don"t have time, so it"s better to leave these matters to others. You should concentrate on finding the keykeepers" tents so that we can get to the Kurla stronghold."
map.hc1_main:2.event.2.description: We really don"t have much time, and we have a long way to go.  Hardac recommends that you find someone to teach you and your captains logistics skills so that everyone can quickly traverse these wastelands.
map.hc1_main:2.event.3.description: "King Tarnum," says your advisor, Hardac.  "I met a man on the road with a fresh and fast horse. He says he bought it from the stables in the south. We must visit the stables every week if we are to save the bards before Kurl"s deadline passes."
map.hc1_main:2.event.4.description: Again, Hardac gave you good advice.  He proposed that all captains be well trained, even if their duties are limited to gathering resources.  It"s good to have trained commanders on your side, especially if you"re going to fight.
map.hc1_main:2.event.5.description:
A spy has arrived, bringing terrible news.

Out of impatience, or perhaps as a warning, Kurl broke his word and beheaded the eldest bard.  This is very depressing news, for the oldest bard was also the greatest sage, and now his knowledge has been lost forever.  This act only confirms how urgent your mission is and how cruel your enemies are.

That night you lie awake wondering what stories of barbarian history were lost with the death of the old bard.  In some way you have already failed your people.  A piece of their identity was lost forever.

You get up from your bed, fall to your knees and tear the ground with your hands.  Gritting your teeth, you swear: "I will never let you down again!"
map.hc1_main:2.event.6.description:
The scout brings a leaflet that was placed on the doors of all the houses in the area during the night.  The author is Kurl.

"The arrogance of the so-called barbarian king, Tarnum, caused the death of an innocent. Like a coward he refused to face me and now the poor old man is dead. Let this be a lesson in the true nature of this criminal who claims to be king. Now I must ask - no, beg - Tarnum to surrender so that no more innocent people suffer."

You crumple the paper in your hand without saying anything.  You can"t help but feel that, in his own way, Kurl is right.
map.hc1_main:2.event.7.description: Kurl"s letter informing about the death of the eldest bard has undermined the trust of your people.  Many stopped working, others fled, taking their resources with them.  There"s nothing you can do about it, you have to keep fighting.
map.hc1_main:2.event.8.description: While enjoying your evening meal with the soldiers, the words of an older, slightly gray-haired goblin caught your attention: "If you don"t know it already, my king, it"s worth visiting the stone of knowledge. Everyone should do it. There"s always a lot to learn there."
map.hc1_main:2.event.9.description:
And again, that grizzled goblin who calls himself your advisor (laughable) gives you great advice.

"When you come across a mercenary camp, send all your captains to it," says the goblin.  "Training with mercenaries will pay off in all future battles."
map.hc1_main:2.monster.22.26.0.message: "Back off, little man! It"s Cyclops gold - it won"t help your ridiculous little war!" shouts the Royal Cyclops, who is guarding this mine.
map.hc1_main:3.event.0.description:
Standing with the captains over a map of the swamp sketched in the sand, you plan your strategy for further fighting, but your advisor Hardac shakes his head in disapproval.

"We know that the gnols and lizardmen are fighting for power - civil wars are unpredictable and chaotic. Now is a good time to attack, but you must hurry, my king, before they choose a new ruler!"
map.hc1_main:3.event.1.description: "Look for the clairvoyant huts," says the wise woman you met outside your tent that morning.  Maybe she"s just a crazy old lady, but something about the way she disappeared when you looked away made you choose to follow her advice.
map.hc1_main:3.event.10.description:
Your trusted advisor, Hardac, came in today looking unhappy.

"Why don"t you ever bring good news?" you joked.

"But at least I"m not an old goblin," replied Hardac.

When I had finished laughing, Hardac said: "After this incident with the fake gold, we will need more money, my king. I think we should sell any surplus - sulfur, gems and other raw materials. We probably won"t get good prices at the market, but at least we will get some gold."
map.hc1_main:3.event.11.description:
You spent another wonderful day with Yalla and you can"t imagine any greater happiness.  And when she was on the horse, ready to go, you placed your hand on her knee.

"Stay," you said softly.  "I hate the moment when you drive away."

She glanced down at you, running her fingers through your long hair.

"But it makes you happier when I come back. You can wait a few days. You know, even kings don"t always get what they want."

And she drove away.
map.hc1_main:3.event.12.description: During her last visit, Yalla promised to return in a few days.  It"s been nine!  You were so concerned that you sent four scouts to four different corners of the world to look for the barbarian warrior.
map.hc1_main:3.event.13.description:
A newly arrived scout nervously tells you the bad news.

The sorcerers of Bracaduun finally pulled the thorn out of their side.  Yalla was captured during a robbery of a gold mine - apparently it was a trap from which she had no chance to escape.  A scout witnessed Yalla"s public execution.  She stood firm in front of her captors and spat in the face of the sorcerer who cast a deadly lightning spell on her.

You clench your fists and order no one to disturb you.  You spend hours chopping logs into splinters too small to build a solid fire, all the while imagining that the logs are dressed in colorful sorcerers" robes.
map.hc1_main:3.event.14.description: Again, Hardac gave you good advice.  He proposed that all captains be well trained, even if their duties are limited to gathering resources.  It"s good to have trained commanders on your side, especially if you"re going to fight.
map.hc1_main:3.event.2.description: The bards inform you that many years ago, three border gates were built to separate the swamps from your homeland.  This is the only road between these regions.  If you capture the passages, you will be able to get to the swamps while being sure that the enemy will not attack by surprise.
map.hc1_main:3.event.3.description: During a routine meeting, one of the captains reminds us that we need to make weekly visits to the mill.  This way you can gain additional resources.
map.hc1_main:3.event.4.description:
Her name is Yalla.  She came to your camp leading a few sheep, but as soon as you looked at her you knew she was not a shepherdess.  A sword at her side, a watchful look - she is a warrior.

She made a good deal selling sheep to your army.

Even though you weren"t handling the transaction in person, your eyes met as she collected her payment.  She didn"t look away or seem intimidated by your presence.  She nodded, smiled and left without a word.

This is probably what barbarian women were like in Jarg"s time.  Proud, wild, independent.  You"ve heard bardic tales of brave women dying alongside their men, of entire families of heroes facing great threats.  Today, only a few women use swords and dare to travel alone in these harsh areas.
map.hc1_main:3.event.5.description:
Yalla visited your camp again.  This time she had information to sell, so you invited her to your tent for a private conversation.

She said there was a fierce battle between three sides in the Mudlands.  Miralda the witch fights under the orange banner.  Wystan, the lizardman, is blue in color.  The gnol Alkin, on the other hand, flies a red flag.  Each of them is a difficult opponent, but fortunately they are blinded by mutual hatred and fight fiercely among themselves.

Yalla"s information cost you dearly, but at least you could talk to her alone for a while.  When you asked what clan she was from, she froze and her eyes turned cold.

"I don"t belong to any," she said, "since we opposed the sorcerers. Men died in battle. My mother and the other women of the clan were not so lucky when the sorcerers decided to punish us."

"Join me! All the clans stand behind me. Join my army and you can take revenge. I swear."

"When we were in need, no clan helped us, so I don"t want their help now!"

Yalla left in a bad mood.
map.hc1_main:3.event.6.description:
"Lord, sir," shouts the grizzled goblin who has appointed himself as your advisor.

"Yeah, ahem, what do they call you there?" you ask.

"I"ve just made a great discovery," the goblin says, as if he hadn"t heard the question. "I climbed to the top of the tree - what a view there is, boy! You know what? You could even spot the enemy that way!" With that, the crazy old goblin dances away in a strange dance.
map.hc1_main:3.event.7.description:
Every night you feel anxious as you wander through the camp, waiting for the arrival of the beautiful warrior, Yalla.  She"s been fighting sorcerers longer than you, and you feel like you have a lot in common - as if she knows you better than your friend Hardac.

She finally showed up trying to sell more goods stolen from Bracaduun.

You invite her for a meal.  Over honey and mutton, you talk late into the night about your dream to recreate the former power of the barbarians.

"I want to give our people the strength so that one day every man, woman and child will choose death rather than bend their necks in shame," you say.

"You mean the day when men get to work instead of sitting around drinking and complaining about their fate," Yalla replied bitterly.  "That would be nice."
map.hc1_main:3.event.8.description:
Yalla left before you woke up.  This time she didn"t give you the opportunity to try to stop her.  Even though you understand why she chose to fight alone, you wish she would trust you and fight by your side.  Together, the two of you could achieve so much more - maybe even destroy the entire Bracaduun Empire.

A barbarian king ruling a kingdom stretching from sea to sea, like Jarg!  But you realize that this is no longer your only dream.  This is a goal you wish to share with the barbarian warrior, Yalla.
map.hc1_main:3.event.9.description:
You were called to the well-guarded gold carts and were surprised to find a shaking Hardak there, pouring coins into one of the bags.  When he reached out, pieces of rusty iron fell to the ground.

"What does that mean?" you ask.

"It turns out, my king, that some of the gold we collected was fake. Perhaps due to some sorcery," says Hardac.

"How much was it?" you ask.

"I don"t know, but I"ll check it out."
map.hc1_main:3.quest.53.43.0.completed: At last!  You made it in time.  I guess the titan is going to do something bad to my kneecaps if he doesn"t get 9,000 gold pieces.  And yes, I did promise you a reward, didn"t I?
map.hc1_main:3.quest.53.43.0.firstVisit: Well, betting with a titan actually wasn"t very wise, you don"t have to tell me that!  I owe him a lot of gold - 9,000 to be exact - and I need to pay it back quickly.  If I"m late, the titan will turn me into minced meat.  If you help me, I will give you something.  But hurry up!  Titan won"t wait too long.
map.hc1_main:3.quest.53.43.0.nextVisit: Oh no, that"s not enough.  I need 9000 gold pieces.  Didn"t you hear what I said?
map.hc1_main:3.sign.37.3.0.message: Lost Gold Mine - Beware of BIG snakes
map.hc1_main:4.event.0.description:
A shaman woke you up.  "I had a dream, my king! A dream about your death, that our enemies killed you in these mountains."

So you ask: "Is this a prophecy or just a dream?"

"Yes, my king, it is a prophecy," replies the shaman.  "But it doesn"t have to work. You just need to create a powerful artifact, Titan"s Thunderbolt! If we have its power, our enemies" armies will be no match for us."
map.hc1_main:4.event.1.description:
A visit to the local witch turned out to be useful.  Not only did she heal your wounds right away, but she also told you how to bring the titan"s lightning to life.

"Find four artifacts - the Titan Gladius, the Titan Armor, the Thunder Helm, and the Sky Guardian"s Shield. With these items, you will gain power beyond your dreams. Search for the mage"s hut and he will show you the way."
map.hc1_main:4.event.10.description: Today you promoted Hardak"s eldest son, Tordak, to captain. This young warrior is a charismatic leader - the soldiers like him very much.  Despite weeks of depression, you smile at the parental pride on your old friend"s face.  It"s a good day.
map.hc1_main:4.event.11.description:
It was a terrible day.

You had to kill the leader of the orcs who had fought alongside you from the very beginning, a powerful captain and a good leader.  But Ungrod allowed himself too much.  It all happened so quickly - Ungrod said that you put your own desire for revenge ahead of the good of the clans.

"You are as arrogant as the sorcerers!"

These words made you furious.  You drew your swords.  The duel was short.
map.hc1_main:4.event.12.description: A soldier arrived at the camp barely alive.  He brought information about another ambush.  He was part of a small group that was trying to secretly transport some gold to your territory, but one night while they were setting up camp, two giants appeared out of nowhere.  Security was unable to cope with these monsters, and the soldier who had just arrived barely managed to escape with his life.  Unfortunately, the gold was lost.
map.hc1_main:4.event.13.description:
Ambushes had become a nuisance to you, so you gathered your captains and advisors to ask how they were going to counter them.  The son of your friend Hardak stepped forward first.

"Ambush, my king," said Tordac.  "Carts with goods and disguised soldiers prepared for a surprise attack. We will spread rumors that we carry half of our gold in these carts so that the sorcerers will not resist the temptation."

It"s a good idea, especially for someone so young.  You are impressed, so you appoint Tordak as commander of the entire enterprise.
map.hc1_main:4.event.14.description:
A pair of ogres arrived, carrying between them the body of Hardak"s son, Tordak.  The trap was a success, but the price was too high.

They were attacked by several giants led by a powerful sorcerer, which explains why enemies appeared and disappeared so quickly.  Tordac and the other soldiers fought bravely, and Tordac even managed to kill the sorcerer before he himself died.

Later Hardac arrived, distraught at the sight of his son"s body and filled with grief.

Putting your hand on your friend"s shoulder, you say, "He died on the field of glory. You should be proud."

Hardac looked at you and you saw the resignation in his eyes as he said, "I brought him here."
map.hc1_main:4.event.2.description: Months of constant fighting have taught you to be ready for battle at any moment.  To the east, the Battlements loom on the horizon, a lofty mountain range bristling with the watchtowers of your enemies.  Even Jarg did not attempt to break through these mountains; you must accomplish a feat that no one has ever done before.
map.hc1_main:4.event.3.description:
You"ve decided to dine alone in your tent, so you look a little annoyed when you see your advisor and friend, Hardak.

"What happened, my king? Is it about that barbarian woman?"

"No, nothing happened," you reply, although Hardac is right.  You miss Yalla, even though you only knew her for such a short time.

Hardac didn"t pursue the topic further, but when he left, you regretted lying to him.  And not only that, you also feel very alone... again.
map.hc1_main:4.event.4.description: Nothing, not even the memory of past victories, brings you joy.  You still hear dozens of stories about the armies that failed to cross the Battlements and the torture that befell them for daring to try.
map.hc1_main:4.event.5.description:
You conferred with the bards for a long time about the history of the Blanks, especially the fighting in this area.  What they had to say didn"t give you courage.

No one has been able to conquer these mountains.  There are too many locks in them.  But one of the tactics was never used.  An attack by a real horde - an army so numerous it could break the world"s neck!

You have to create such an army.
map.hc1_main:4.event.6.description: According to the latest reports, supply trucks were attacked. The enemy literally appeared out of nowhere and just as mysteriously disappeared.  The trackers tried to follow him, but found no one.  As if the enemy had never appeared there.
map.hc1_main:4.event.7.description: While sitting at your evening meal, you listen to one of the warriors talk about the raiders" secret hideout - Raider"s Plateau.  It is said that these bandits know the secret passage through the Blanches and are therefore able to freely attack the supply trains for the magician kings of Bracaduun.  If only it could be true!
map.hc1_main:4.event.8.description:
It"s gotten to the point where even some of your commanders are starting to question your plan.

"What do we care about Bracaduun? We have already regained our homeland!" they say.

But you don"t agree with them.  How could you allow an enemy to fearlessly fortify itself in its castles and plot to enslave a barbarian nation again?  After all, they killed entire families, for example in the case of Yalla.

Even your family has been separated.  For two days a year, your mother bursts into tears remembering the birthdays of your two older sisters.  Bracaduun"s law stated that no barbarian family could have more than one child, and your parents were so poor that they needed a son to help them with their hard work.  They didn"t want it, but they had to give their two daughters to the sorcerers.

And then there"s what they did to Yalla...
map.hc1_main:4.event.9.description: Your army"s supply lines have been hit again.  This was no ordinary ambush.  The enemy attacked quickly and disappeared before the troops assigned to guard the wagons could react.  You must expect heavy losses until you manage to eliminate these ambushes.
map.hc1_main:4.guards.104.19.0.message: "Attention," the advisor says as you approach the monolith.  "The signs on this portal say it will only take you in one direction. Once you pass through it, you can"t go back - and rumors say there"s a large enemy army camped on the other side!"
map.hc1_main:4.guards.21.100.0.message: While digging graves for some of the dead, your men find treasure buried in the ground (presumably stolen from the magician kings).  You certainly need it no less than the one who once stole it.
map.hc1_main:5.event.0.description:
An exhausted group of soldiers from the rear guard brings terrible news.  A great collapse - undoubtedly caused by a magical earthquake - destroyed half of your army and supply wagons.  The rest of the army is trapped on the other side of the Blanks and is unable to reach you.

Your forces have been decimated and surrounded.  You only have the vanguard troops you led with you and a small garrison force behind you.  The soldiers will hold the garrison for a while, but it won"t last forever.
map.hc1_main:5.event.1.description:
News has arrived from barbarian rebels loyal to your cause.  They occupied the passage in the north, the passage to the lands settled long ago by the descendants of Jarg.  They will hold it - allowing only you to pass.

Surely the blood of the first king of the horde flowing in your veins will defend you against your enemies...

If you can only reach them.
map.hc1_main:5.event.10.description:
Hardac returned from scouting just in time for your lunch.  When he got off the horse, you noticed that he was bleeding.

"What happened?" you ask.

"Nothing, my king. The horse got scared at the sight of the snake and threw me off. I hurt my knee, that"s all - it will heal. But I will choose another horse."
map.hc1_main:5.event.11.description:
One of the scouting parties returned today without their leader, Bloodclub.  When you ask what happened to the ogre, they say that the Bloodclub wandered away from the group to hunt a boar.  When he did not return for a long time, the scouts assumed that a boar had torn him apart and returned to camp.

You turn to Hardak and shake your head: "Something stinks here, my friend. Someone look for him."
map.hc1_main:5.event.12.description:
A group of soldiers returned from the forest carrying the body of the Bloodclub captain.  After careful inspection, you discover that Bloodclub died in battle, but not to a boar as was said.

Someone killed him, but it wasn"t murder.  He has many wounds, but only one serious one.  It was probably a fair fight, but who would choose to fight an ogre fairly?  And why?  You have no evidence, but you look at Hardak and the other captains, who stand around stoically.

It had to be one of them.  You see it in their eyes.  Probably some form of lynching... or they just didn"t like him.  It was one of them, you"re sure, but you"re afraid to guess which one.
map.hc1_main:5.event.13.description:
Battlefield.

You"ve seen so many of them that you can assess the situation in the blink of an eye.  But it"s different here.  You stand alone, realizing that this is another nightmare, but you can"t (or don"t want to) wake up.  It"s more than just a dream, it"s almost like someone is whispering something in your ear.

At your feet lie everyone you have ever known, friends and enemies.  There is also Yalla, dead by your sword.  And your mother, your father.  There are also both of your sisters as little girls, although that is impossible.  They are older than you, after all.

There is also Hardac, next to his son, Tordak.  Bloodclub, the old bard with an arrow in his back, the sorcerer Kurl, your captains, your soldiers and many others - their bodies are lying on top of each other.

All dead by your sword.

And then you wake up.  This time, however, you cannot forget the dream, even though you would like to.
map.hc1_main:5.event.14.description:
That morning, you and Hardac rode out to the top of the hill to look around.  As you stopped to admire the green fields, you asked, "How"s your knee?"

Hardac shrugged and replied: "I"m not that young anymore, wounds don"t heal as quickly as they used to."

"I need to know something, my friend," you say.

"Whatever you want."

"Are you and the other captains with me?"

It took a long moment for your friend to respond.

"They miss their home and their families, that"s all," Hardac finally said.
map.hc1_main:5.event.2.description: "All we need to do now," says your advisor, Hardac, "is to get through the northern passage. Our soldiers are tired and weak - I doubt we can defeat the sorcerers. In the land of Jarg"s descendants we will find protection."
map.hc1_main:5.event.3.description:
You underestimated the power of Bracaduun"s magician kings.  So far you have won often - almost unexpectedly often.  Nothing has withstood your power.  Until now.

You can"t help but feel guilty for the hundreds of soldiers buried on the Battlements under tons of rocks.  These were your soldiers.  And as you tighten your grip on the hilt of your sword, you swear that those who died will be avenged.
map.hc1_main:5.event.4.description: You have awakened.  Your body feels sluggish, long hair wet with sweat clinging to your skin.  A few seconds pass before you realize where you are, and by that time the dream that woke you up is gone - forgotten forever.
map.hc1_main:5.event.5.description:
You reluctantly name Hardak"s son as a successor.  Your choice is a fire ogre named Bloodclub.  Although not the brightest of captains, Bloodclub makes a fearsome impression on the battlefield.  And now the time of rage and pogrom has come.

Even though you have won every battle so far, it seems that the sorcerers are always ready and willing to parry any blow, just as they did when they prepared the ambush in the Battlements.  Now it was time for Bracaduun to tremble in terror.
map.hc1_main:5.event.6.description:
How did you come to be separated from your army?

You wander through the misty swamps, surrounded by shadows slipping between trees with twisted branches.  It"s probably an enemy preparing to attack!  You draw your sword in anticipation of your impending death.

When they finally come at you, coming from all sides, you attack the one in front and deliver a fatal slash.  You realize too late that the leader was the only woman you loved, Yalla.

And then you wake up in your tent, drenched in sweat.
map.hc1_main:5.event.7.description:
Hardac entered your tent with a grim face.  You"re waiting for news.

"It"s about the Bloodclub, my king," says Hardac.

"Dead?" you ask.

"No, that"s not it. He stole sheep and pigs from enemy villages and apparently found hiding sorcerers in the process. The Bloodclub killed the sorcerers and then began the slaughter! He killed everyone in the village for hiding sorcerers, even the children. As if that wasn"t enough, he set fire to the buildings and left the bodies among the ashes!"

You nod, knowing that Hardac and the other captains expect you to punish the ogre for hurting the innocent, but somehow you can"t find Bloodclub guilty or his actions wrong.  This is war, after all.  And how can you protect these so-called innocents if they are helping Bracaduun?

"I"ll take care of it, Hardac."
map.hc1_main:5.event.8.description:
Today he returned from his Bloodclub mission and immediately appeared at your tent.

"You called for me, my king?"

"Yes," you answer, "you murdered innocent people. They were unarmed, I heard you slaughtered them all."

The ogre froze upon hearing this accusation and replied, "They were hiding sorcerers. They were enemies. Besides, sorcerers don"t need weapons to kill!"

You nod, realizing that Bloodclub has a point.  "But don"t do it again. You can leave."
map.hc1_main:5.event.9.description:
"Is that all you plan to do about it, my king? The Bloodclub took to the field today - I thought they would be punished," Hardac said.

You shake your head and say, "My friend, he is a great commander and a good fighter. I cannot afford to lose someone like that now. You may remember that we have few soldiers, fewer than ever!"

"So," says Hardac, numbly, "he only got a slap for murdering children?" Without waiting for an answer, Hardac left.  You hope that over time he will calm down and admit that you are right.
map.hc1_main:5.guards.12.28.0.message: Bandits!  These brutal murderers have no intention of arguing.  They draw their weapons and immediately attack.
map.hc1_main:5.guards.43.45.0.message: You see a golden bow hanging from a tree branch, but you can"t just take it.  First, you need to defeat the king griffins surrounding the tree.  Do you want to fight them?
map.hc1_main:5.guards.7.45.0.message: The air around you breaks and you rub your eyes, realizing you"ve spent too many hours in the saddle.  When everything returns to normal, you find yourself surrounded.  Magic ambush!
map.hc1_main:6.event.0.description: Currently, the magician kings are preparing for their next attack.  Perhaps you will be able to rebuild your army by recruiting the descendants of Jarg, who are said to inhabit this valley.  It was truly a great army!  So you send advisors to the surrounding cities to recruit a new horde to replace the one that fell in the Battlements.
map.hc1_main:6.event.1.description:
This morning you gave all captains the following order:

"Burn everything! I don"t want us to be left with anything more than scorched earth - no houses, no wagons, no crops!

These seasoned warriors flinched and looked displeased, but your steely glare made it clear to them that there would be no arguments.
map.hc1_main:6.event.10.description:
A commotion in the opposite part of the camp drew your attention to an argument between two captains.  Their clumsy movements showed that they were drunk.  You watch a fist fight that even starts to amuse you.  If it"s a dispute, it should be resolved.

But suddenly one of the veterans pulled out a knife from his upper and before anyone could react, his opponent fell dead.  You can"t believe it.  Everyone knows you don"t recognize weapons in wrestling!  The law of "blood for blood" requires that the one who used the knife also die.  But you"ve lost too many captains lately to punish him as an example.  Everyone is looking at you, waiting for your verdict.

"The dispute has been settled," you say and walk away.
map.hc1_main:6.event.11.description:
At night you slipped out of the tent, covering yourself in black fur to hide yourself.  Moving carefully and quietly, you can hear the captains talking.

"He"s going crazy!" said one.

"It"s an exaggeration! It"s just an exaggeration! It means that we have to kill innocent people here! The unarmed! Why?" another one almost shouts.

And then you hear Hardak"s voice.  "Stop! This is stupid talk - but dangerous. Tarnum is the king and he is the one who freed our people from the yoke of slavery!"
map.hc1_main:6.event.12.description:
"Yes, he has done great things. And we love him for that. But now he is exaggerating, it"s too much. What are we doing here anyway?" replied one of the captains.

"We fight," replied Hardac.

"We have had enough of fighting, Hardac," said one of the senior commanders, "and we think you have too. Tarnum"s war is beginning to cost us too much, it has already cost you your son"s life."

There was a long silence, followed by Hardak"s sharp command: "Disperse!"

So at least Hardac is still loyal to you.
map.hc1_main:6.event.13.description:
Hardac entered your tent.  It"s late - everyone except the guards is already asleep.

"It"s time for us to stop this killing, King Tarnum," he said.

You are surprised and a bit hurt that he has joined the other captains and, like them, is against you.  What should you do now?  Together, the captains are too powerful to impose their will on them by force.  However, as long as Hardac was not on their side, they would not dare to do anything, but together with him, they can forcibly remove you from command.

You close your eyes and say: "Perhaps you are right, my friend. We will talk about returning home when we will not be threatened by Jarg"s descendants. Perhaps we will have a feast? I promise."

Hardac nods and smiles.

"It will be best, my king."
map.hc1_main:6.event.2.description: Villages are burning everywhere, but your scouts report that large numbers of refugees are moving across the countryside.  Refugees?  Or troops waiting for an opportunity to attack?
map.hc1_main:6.event.3.description: Earlier, you sent a small group to destroy a nearby village, but the soldiers never returned.  Fearing the worst, you follow their trail, the village is untouched and there are no signs of battle.  Is it possible for them all to disappear?
map.hc1_main:6.event.4.description:
The trackers returned, leading the missing unit under the command of a goblin captain named Derg.

"What happened to them?" you ask.

The tracker shrugs.  "Nothing, King. They are alive and well - and from what I see, they are returning home."
map.hc1_main:6.event.5.description: Deserter!  One of the captains!  This must be dealt with quickly and without mercy, or others will draw the wrong conclusions.  They will start to think that you are losing control of your people.  So you send a unit under Hardak"s command to capture the coward and bring him back alive.
map.hc1_main:6.event.6.description:
As you visit the smoking ruins of a village inhabited by traitors who were killed by your soldiers, you notice a familiar face among the bodies.  You kneel next to the dead woman"s body and see that she is a perfect copy of your mother, only younger - probably a bit older than you.

Even though you have never seen your eldest sister (she was taken by sorcerers before you were born), you know in your heart that she is Anada.  You start sobbing.
map.hc1_main:6.event.7.description:
You feel like you"ve seen this before.  A terrible dream that is actually more than just a dream.  The dead body of Yalla, killed by your hand.  Your mother, father and sisters (still as little girls, even though you know that"s impossible).  There is also Hardac, Tordac, the old bard with the arrow in his back, the sorcerer Kurl, your captains, your soldiers and many others - bodies forming one big pile.

All dead from the blows of your sword.

And then you wake up.
map.hc1_main:6.event.8.description:
Hardac returned with the deserter goblin, Derg, in chains.  Derg still has a provoking look even as he falls at your feet.

"And his people?" you ask Hardak.

"They"re all dead," your friend replies.  You turn to Derg.

"A deserter doesn"t deserve to die in battle," you say.

"Then hang me! I"m ashamed of what you made me do. I wish I had escaped sooner!"

You finally show mercy and allow the Derg to fight for their freedom.  But his opponent is Hardac, so the fight doesn"t last long.
map.hc1_main:6.event.9.description:
Strategy meetings are getting quieter and quieter, you"re basically the only one talking most of the time.  There was a time when everyone shouted over each other to present their ideas.  You"ve had enough of this.

You stick your dagger into the sand. "What"s going on? You"re acting like a bunch of deaf kids!"

No answer.  They raised their heads and looked at you, but the old adoration was no longer visible in their eyes.  It turned into something else.  Maybe in fear?
map.hc1_main:6.monster.10.15.0.message:
A large group slowly moves through the swampy terrain.

"Another bunch of these sickly peasants, my king," says one of the captains.  "They are probably not worth our effort."

"I"m the one who assesses the situation. Kill everyone!" you reply.
map.hc1_main:6.monster.22.32.0.message:
A group of peasants block the passage, but when they recognize you, they try to move aside.  When you ask them to join you, they shake their heads.

"The sorcerers will punish us if we help you. Besides, we heard that you will die soon, and what will become of us then?"

You can"t believe your ears.  Blood from Jarg"s blood, and they ally with spellcasters!  Sensing that if the sorcerers order them to fight on their side, these people will join the fight, you decide that it is better to eliminate this threat immediately.
map.hc1_main:7.event.0.description:
You thought that some of the soldiers would desert or mutiny after learning about the murder of Hardak and the other captains, but it"s exactly the opposite.  Your soldiers love you.  And they especially love the victories they achieve with you.  Now you have promised that you will finally break the backs of these insidious sorcerers.

"Castle Steelhorn, this impregnable bastion, will fall before us! For all eternity the deeds we perform here will be celebrated. Your grandchildren and your grandchildren"s grandchildren, I will repeat your names with pride. This time we fight for immortality - and we will all earn our places among the Ancestors !
map.hc1_main:7.event.1.description: Spies report that there are at least two castles and three towers between your position and Castle Steelhorn, but the enemy is unprepared.  Your horde arrived here so quickly that Bracaduun failed to decimate them.  But it"s not time to rest.  If you attack quickly, you will gain a great advantage over them.
map.hc1_main:7.event.10.description:
A messenger arrived today from the magician kings.  You ordered him to be brought before you, but not too close. It smelled too much of perfume.

"I have a proposition for you, King Tarnum!" he said.

"Aha, so I"m King Tarnum now?" you reply.  "I still remember how they called me bandit."

"Oh, well, erm, it was a great mistake on our part. We admit our mistake and propose peace between our great nations. We beg you, agree to end this senseless killing!"

You burst out laughing at this blatant sign of weakness.  You finally broke the magician kings.

"For me, this killing is not senseless," you finally answer.  "Your people have oppressed my people for generations. You have almost succeeded in stripping us of our identity. Well, now the wind is blowing from a different direction and it is a gale that will not cease as long as a single sorcerer or sorcerer"s supporter remains alive!"
map.hc1_main:7.event.11.description:
Today the scouts came, bringing with them an old man.  Even as you approached, you recognized the poor old man as your father.  As you helped him off his horse, you noticed that he was too weak to walk.

"We found him on the road, my king. He said he wanted to find you," said one of the scouts.

You immediately call a witch to take care of your sick father.
map.hc1_main:7.event.12.description:
The father has been in bed for five days with no signs of improvement.  This morning the healers said he was close to death, so you went to him immediately.  He woke up as you sat by the bed, but it took him a few moments to recognize you.

"What happened?" you ask.  "Why are you here?"

"I"ve heard things... stories... about you, my son," the father replied.

"What things? Certainly nothing worth the long drive!"

"Things that scared me... I was afraid of the path you took... I had to..."

The father fell and never woke up again.  Those were his last words and you convince yourself that you don"t even know what he meant.  Or at least you"re not sure.  Even before you went to bed, you knew that you would have THAT DREAM again today.
map.hc1_main:7.event.13.description:
One of the servants brought a message scrawled in clumsy handwriting on the fabric of the sorcerer"s toga.  "Krulu. I"m looking for a poisoner. He hasn"t found the wizard. I wonder who???"

The caption only says an X, but you"re sure the author of this information is a mad goblin.  Who knew this idiot could write?
map.hc1_main:7.event.14.description:
A soft noise wakes you, and as you open your eyes, you see the tip of a dagger blade in front of you.  On the other side of the dagger you see a gray-haired goblin who has been a thorn in your side for some time now.  He jumped towards you, so you pretended to give up while searching for the knife hidden under the bed.

"I found the one who murdered the commanders!" says the goblin.
map.hc1_main:7.event.15.description:
Thinking that the goblin has discovered that you were the one who poured poison into your captains" goblets, you strike and plunge your knife into the goblin"s chest up to the hilt.  He falls to the ground with a look of complete surprise on his face.

"Why did you do that? I wanted to tell you... that it was my fault... the moose we ate, I didn"t hunt it. I found it by the road, it had been dead for two days... it must have been rotten... I poisoned it all of them... You should know that, right?"

"Yes," you lied.  Poor old fool.

"Well, I got what I deserved," the old goblin muttered before blood gushed from his mouth.  "One day we will all get what we deserve."

And he died.
map.hc1_main:7.event.16.description:
The nightmare begins just like THIS DREAM - your family, Yalla, Hardac and your captains, everyone you have ever known, lie dead at your feet.  You hold a bloody sword in your hand.

And then you enter a great hall and in front of you is a huge door, bigger than you have ever seen.  And somehow, your parents, Yalla, your sisters, Hardac, and everyone else are standing at that door with you.

They look at you with disgust and don"t say a word.  And then they turn their backs on you.  And the dream ends, leaving you convinced that you will never dream again.
map.hc1_main:7.event.2.description: Like every morning, you ask a clairvoyant for advice.  The seer throws the dice and looks at them for a long time, and then says: "Put together the scattered man - the legionnaire"s statuette. With it you will gain strength and glory."
map.hc1_main:7.event.3.description:
One of the scouts returned from the ocean, where he had scouted the castle of Bracaduun to the east.  He also told a story that suggests that he looks into the bottle too often.

"I saw this great swirling hole in the water, my king, and one of the Bracaduun ships sailed straight into it. I thought to myself, "They are already dead" as the hole sucked them in. But to my surprise, the ship and its crew They returned the next day - although I believe there were fewer soldiers on board than when they left.
map.hc1_main:7.event.4.description: At least fifty soldiers have come over the last few months to tell you that they have children that they have named after you.  The fact that the soldiers honor you in this way relieves the pain temporarily, and more importantly, their faith in you and the correctness of your choices gives you great joy.
map.hc1_main:7.event.5.description:
That dream again.

THIS DREAM - that"s what you call it now.  Always the same.  Always everyone you know is dead.  And you know that they died by your hand.

But it"s just a dream, right?  You would never hurt Yalla or your parents or... well, your sister"s death was a mistake.  If the sorcerers hadn"t taken her from the house, "this" would never have happened, right?

And Hardac, well, you had to kill him and the other captains.  You regret it, but Hardac had to die for the sake of your people.  Hardac and the other captains did not understand that the magician kings had to be completely destroyed, just as a gangrened limb had to be cut off completely to prevent the disease from spreading throughout the body.
map.hc1_main:7.event.6.description: People say that in these regions even the land is imbued with magic.  Sorcerers have lived here for hundreds of years, and as a result, their spells and magical experiments have soaked into the soil like water into a dry riverbed.  Now the earth sparkles with this enchantment, and the magical power of anyone who stands on it is much greater.
map.hc1_main:7.event.7.description:
Since your horde has lost some of its numbers over the last few months, it might be worth recruiting in one or two of Bracaduun"s cities.  It won"t be difficult to force the inhabitants to switch sides once you control their families.

Fast and powerful units like archangels will make great allies - and you know they"ll also fight in the enemy"s ranks.  As your people say: "Never start a sword fight with a spoon in your hand!"
map.hc1_main:7.event.8.description:
A familiar old goblin emerges from behind the trees - the nameless one who has appointed himself as your advisor.  You thought he was dead.

"My king! My king!" he shouts and waves his arms.  "Someone poisoned all your advisors! Something like that! I can"t believe it, all these great heroes died such a despicable death. We need to find the culprit!"

Your hand began searching for your sword.  You wonder how you could have missed it, but before you could reach the handle, the mad advisor disappeared into the trees.
map.hc1_main:7.event.9.description:
You learned that the place where you grew up has grown in importance since you left it and is now the center of trade and culture in the Wasteland.  The people living there named the new city after you - Tarnia.

In fact, artists have even started building a large monument in your honor.  Never in your wildest dreams did you suspect that you would achieve such success.  These latest honors push you forward, even more determined to end this war quickly.  Maybe you"ll be able to go home tomorrow.
map.hc1_main:7.guards.14.4.0.message:
You found a bunch of sleazy miners camped along the road. As your army approached them, they did not try to flee.  They are too tired.  Most likely, these men are escaped Bracaduun slaves who wish to join the horde.  You are surprised to learn that they don"t know who you are, so you tell them to go to the back of the column where they will get food.

"Tell them that the King of Tarnum has ordered you to eat," you say as they walk away.  They are so impressed that they want to join your army.
map.hc1_main:7.guards.31.46.0.message:
Something strange is happening on the road in front of you.  A lone man with a shovel furiously digs the road, knocking out stones and throwing them into the nearby bushes.

And he still mutters under his breath: "Who needs expensive roads?"

And then you see him pull a large crate out of the hole and throw it aside with the same care he used to throw stones.  You carefully steal the chest and drive away, opening it later in peace.
map.hc1_main:7.guards.38.2.0.message: You see soldiers resting after a long march, but as you approach, they draw their weapons and stand in formation.  You see that they are carrying an artifact called the Inexhaustible Purse of Gold and they are not going to give it up without a fight.  Are you going to attack them?
map.hc1_main:7.guards.5.66.0.message: There"s a treasure chest on the ground in front of you, apparently forgotten by your fleeing enemies.  You order the servants to open it.   Unfortunately, the box explodes, the minions disappear, and a group of genies emerge from the falling smoke surrounding the trap box.
map.hc1_main:7.guards.51.11.0.message: Suddenly fog surrounds you.  You can barely see beyond arm"s length, but you still move slowly forward.  Sooner or later you will get out of this fog.  But when the fog finally clears, a small army appears before you, ready to attack.
map.hc1_main:7.guards.57.7.0.message: The ocean stretches out in front of you, but remember that the magician kings have taken over the waters just as they did the land and can attack at any time, so watch your back.
map.hc1_main:7.heroes.40.name: Kurl
map.hc2_main:0.quest.34.26.0.completed: The Guardians appreciate your efforts and reaching level 5. Do you want to move on now?
map.hc2_main:1.guards.65.26.0.message:
A crazed familiar appears out of nowhere and shouts, "You won"t take my treasure! I"ll kill you all!"

He charges straight at your soldiers and dies by the sword.  You shake your head, concluding that these tunnels would drive anyone crazy.  And then you look around and see nothing that even remotely resembles treasure.  Unless it"s those rocks to the west...
map.hc2_main:1.guards.68.7.0.message: The devil"s mist swirls beneath your feet as if it had a mind of its own.  Its cold penetrates with its tongues under the armor, under the clothes, penetrates the skin and freezes the bones.  Only creatures of an evil nature can move in this fog, and on the defenders of good - and such are those who serve in your ranks - it has a decidedly destructive effect.
map.hc2_main:4.town.27.8.0.event.0.descr: The young man who told you about the bag of gold asked for some time to gather his companions, but eventually he succeeded.  Now you have an additional squad of pikemen.
map.hc2_main:4.town.27.8.0.name: Worthington
map.hc2_main:6.guards.35.34.0.message: Jorm is close.  Soon Rion Gryphonheart"s soul will be free and return to paradise - our long journey will come to an end.
map.hc3_main:0.guards.12.28.0.message: You stop for a short rest. Dismounting from your horse"s back, you find a four-leaf clover at your feet.  You pick a leaf of happiness and pin it to your clothes.
map.hc3_main:0.guards.23.31.0.message:
"Lord Tarnum", Barsolar, my assistant, wants something again. "I"d suggest defeating those annoying air elementals and taking over the gold mines. You know how expensive wizards are, right?"

I had to sit on my hands to avoid punching that cramp in the nose.
map.hc3_main:0.guards.31.6.0.message: A thorough search of this area finally paid off.  You find a hidden supply of raw materials and quickly load them onto the cart - before the owner returns.
map.hc3_main:0.guards.32.11.0.message: From where you are standing, you see a golden gleam and you know that it must be the famous inexhaustible purse of gold.  Unfortunately, the golems guarding it also shine gold.  When you touch the pouch with your hand, they will be activated and you will have to fight.  Are you sure you are interested in fighting the golden golem squad?
map.hc3_main:0.guards.4.7.0.message: But those stupid magicians weren"t lying - as you approached the city, two magical beings appeared before you.
map.hc3_main:0.monster.20.3.0.message: Too late you notice a group of iron golems and activate them by approaching the crystal cave they are guarding.
map.hc3_main:0.monster.21.17.0.message: We will be happy to support your cause if you can ensure peace and safety for our temple!
map.hc3_main:0.monster.22.13.0.message: You are not our creator.  There is no passage.  On the orders of our creator, we will kill you!
map.hc3_main:0.monster.26.12.0.message: In recent years, we have learned a lot from the lords of the elements, and yet this is only a fraction of their knowledge.  We can"t let you carry out your stupid plan and kill our teachers.  Surrender immediately or we will be forced to attack!
map.hc3_main:0.monster.6.34.0.message:
Gargoyles!  If it were up to me, I would never accept them into my army.

These unnatural creatures give me chills.  They are not alive according to the laws of nature - they are stones brought to life by spells.  Their eyes don"t blink.  They don"t eat, they don"t breathe.  Yet they follow orders and guard their masters like dogs.
map.hc3_main:0.monster.8.32.0.message: How dare you raise your hand against these extraordinary and beautiful creatures! Elementals deserve respect, and you murder them with impunity! You"ll pay for this!
map.hc3_main:0.quest.13.35.0.completed: Great! We invite you to buy our best golems! Of course, all at a reasonable price.
map.hc3_main:0.quest.13.35.0.firstVisit: The factory is temporarily closed, we apologize for the problems. However, if you could deliver 23 mercury and 3,500 gold pieces, work would resume immediately!
map.hc3_main:0.quest.13.35.0.nextVisit: 23 mercury and 3,500 gold pieces, that"s all we need!
map.hc3_main:1.event.12.description: One of your mages returned from scouting with bad news: the elemental lord had sent one of his servants on patrol near the portal. There is a high probability that it will detect our presence, so a confrontation is inevitable. We should prepare thoroughly for this meeting!
map.hc3_main:1.guards.16.5.1.message:
You don"t know where Barsolar suddenly appeared next to your horse.  You quickly reach for your waist, but there"s no dagger to pull out.

"Lord Tarnum, this way please!" Barsolar says with a sneer.  He noticed your reaction and feels satisfied.

"What do you want?"

"The Cloud Gateway is located at the end of this path, to the north. I have passed through it and seen the plane of air with my own eyes. It is impressive! But several storm elementals chased me until now a few days ago. I have been waiting here for you ever since." "

Barsolar has rejoined your army, but along with several other sorcerers, he seems to be completely occupied with his observations from the air plane.  At least they"ll leave me alone for a while.
map.hc3_main:1.guards.20.33.0.message: This scroll seems to be guarded by some powerful forces, are you sure you want to reach for the scroll?
map.hc3_main:1.header.rumor.0.text: Have you heard that the airbender has a castle floating on the clouds?
map.hc3_main:1.monster.11.12.1.message: The school is closed to people like you!
map.hc3_main:1.monster.13.25.1.message: This gold belongs to our lord, the lord of the air.  No one else will get it!
map.hc3_main:1.monster.15.35.1.message: You will never be able to defeat the airbender!
map.hc3_main:1.monster.21.32.1.message: We guard this quarry for our lord, the lord of the air!  No one else will get it!
map.hc3_main:1.monster.3.18.1.message: Sir, we have discovered an abandoned city in the east, maybe it would be worth exploring?
map.hc3_main:1.monster.33.13.1.message: Lord, the city is guarded by 3 powerful titans, maybe it"s better to leave them alone?
map.hc3_main:1.monster.33.18.1.message: The bandits just widened their eyes in surprise when they saw you, but they quickly recovered and started attacking.
map.hc3_main:2.guards.16.35.0.message: You are surprised to see the genies in the water dimension, but you quickly notice that they have been trapped as guardians of a pair of magical levitation shoes.  Will you attack to get the shoes?
map.hc3_main:2.guards.58.25.0.message: The water and ice elementals protect a powerful book of water magic left here by the water lord.  You try to lure the creatures away from the book, but they won"t be attracted to anything.  If you want to get the book, you have to fight for it.  Do you want to attack?
map.hc3_main:2.guards.7.58.0.message: ATTENTION! This is the only scenario where navigation will be useful. You learn it at your own risk!
map.hc3_main:3.guards.15.30.0.message: A horde of troglodytes emerges from cracks in a nearby wall.
map.hc3_main:3.guards.17.25.1.message: Is this stone tower hiding from my sight?!
map.hc3_main:3.guards.38.27.0.message: A horde of troglodytes emerges from cracks in a nearby wall.
map.hc3_main:3.guards.42.44.0.message: A pack of troglodytes emerges from cracks in a nearby wall.
map.hc3_main:3.monster.2.49.0.message: Time to chop some heads off!
map.hc3_main:3.town.27.36.0.name: Sodville
map.hc3_main:3.town.6.5.0.event.0.descri: Reamus" mages and golems have agreed to join our forces and fight the elemental lords.
map.hc3_main:3.town.69.4.0.name: Nortown
map.hc3_main:4.event.11.description: We were unable to return to our dimension.  When the airbender left his kingdom, he destroyed the Cloud Gate.  With all these sorcerers at my side, I might have expected one of them to warn me that the only alternative way back was to master the elemental gates.  I had to go all the way here to the fire dimension to defeat the fire elementals and energy elementals.
map.hc3_main:4.event.12.description:
When we met this morning, Barsolar started shaking his head.

"We have tried all night using every magical means, but we simply cannot contact King Magnus."

"So we"re on our own," I said.

"Yes. I"m afraid we"ve been reported missing."

"Well, there"s nothing we can do but continue our march," I replied, trying to hide my pleasure.  Perhaps now no one will interfere with my command of this army of magicians.
map.hc3_main:4.guards.14.15.1.message: There"s no telling what"s inside, but as you approach, your hair stands on end.  Are you sure you want to open this can?
map.hc3_main:4.guards.15.1.0.message: This Pandora"s box rolls violently back and forth, and smoke comes out of the cracks.  Several assistants warn you not to open it, but you don"t want to look like a coward, do you?  Are you opening the can?
map.hc3_main:4.guards.3.22.0.message: A large group of fire elementals emerge from the flames, trying to scare you.  For some reason they are keeping an eye on this Pandora"s box.  Do you want to fight with them for it?
map.hc3_main:4.guards.35.23.1.message: Another can can be seen in the flames.  For some reason you feel a great power emanating from her.  Do you want to open the can now?
map.hc3_main:4.guards.4.13.0.message: When you open Pandora"s box, you prepare for the worst, nothing appears to attack you, so you carefully look inside to see what treasures are hidden inside.
map.hc3_main:4.guards.4.18.0.message: A group of ifrits plunge the cursed one"s shield into a shallow lake of lava.  It doesn"t look like they"re trying to destroy it, so it must be part of the process of forging this powerful artifact.  Are you going to attack the efreet when they"re done and take the shield?
map.hc3_main:4.guards.5.9.0.message:
"Be careful when opening Pandora"s box," warns one adviser.

These magical containers can contain anything, including enemy troops.  Do you want to open the can?
map.hc3_main:4.monster.20.1.0.message:
At first you think the shimmering blue zigzags are lightning, but they stop halfway, change direction and rush towards you.  They block the road and change shape.

"Energy elementals," says one of your young assistants.

"Attack!" you shout.
map.hc3_main:4.monster.34.10.0.message: Thank you for setting us free! How can we return the favor?
map.hc3_main:4.monster.9.10.0.message: The flames here are higher than usual, curling around each other in some strange ceremony.  And then they start to take real shapes - arms, legs, heads.  Suddenly, a group of fire elementals appear in front of you.
map.hc3_main:5.monster.69.3.0.message:
"We are the oldest, we are the first."

Unlike mind elementals, these three magic elementals can speak.

"We know why you have come. The elemental lords desire destruction, they have always desired it, but they do not realize that the universe desires to combine the elements into a harmonious whole. Yes, we will join your fight. This madness must end!"
map.hc3_main:6.guards.13.34.1.message:
Too late you realize that you have fallen into a trap - fire suddenly erupts in front of you and takes the form of many phoenixes taking flight.  At first you watch these beautiful creatures fly above you - alive, fiery, hellishly beautiful.

And then the phoenixes attack.
map.hc3_main:6.guards.23.10.1.message:
A group of dryads flying from above the clouds catches up with you.

"We heard that you intend to free the phoenixes and we want to help you. The imprisonment was the worst thing in the world for us, and even though the phoenixes are different from us, we cannot stand their captivity. Please let us fight in their ranks." That"s after simply wonderful!
map.hc3_main:6.guards.31.34.0.message:
The magma elemental sitting between the flames looks like it"s waiting for someone.  As you approach, the elemental stands up.  You prepare to fight, but the elemental raises its hands to let you know it doesn"t intend to hurt you.

"I have come to teach you and the other members of your army how to summon earth elementals. Only let your heroes return here - I am not asking for a reward, only that you use what I teach you to defeat the earthlord," says the magma elemental.

"Why are you doing this?" you ask him.

"Because some of my kind refuse to destroy what they once helped create!"
map.hc3_main:6.guards.32.34.0.message:
You walk between the tongues of fire, not paying attention to them until they suddenly start climbing up to your legs.  You try to douse the flames, but it doesn"t help.  The fire spreads to the arms, torso and finally to the head.  Just when you are sure you are going to die, you hear a whisper in your ears.

The flames try to teach you how to summon fire elementals.  Now you understand that they will teach this to everyone who comes into this place.
map.hc3_main:6.monster.28.9.0.message: Fire worshipers? In a place like this?
map.hc3_main:6.town.17.31.0.event.0.desc: This way you will give money to the computer.
map.hc3_main:7.guards.101.55.0.message:
Tall flames suddenly emerged from the ground and surrounded you.  You step back for fear of your robes catching fire until you notice a large fiery wing unfold to reveal phoenixes!

One of them croaked, "We have come to join you! We will never again wear the chains of the Fire Lord!"
map.hc3_main:7.guards.47.44.0.message:
As you approach your elemental gates, you find a white iron gate blocking the way.

Before your eyes, the doorposts straighten and transform into twelve magic elementals.

"Good morning! Sorry we"re late. We didn"t miss the fight against the elemental lords, did we?" they ask at the same time.

"No", you answer.

"That"s good!"
map.hc3_main:7.quest.106.48.0.firstVisit: I have an artifact for sale - the cloak of reversal. He will help you fight the elemental lords. The price is only 20 thousand gold pieces!
map.hc3_main:7.quest.106.48.0.nextVisit: Oh no, no. It"s not enough. I need 20000 Gold
map.hc3_main:7.sign.0.65.0.message:
Campaign corrected and modified by {Begrezen}. Thank you for playing. 
---------------------------------------------
Retrieved from War Academy.
map.hc3_main:7.town.49.43.0.event.0.desc: A small group of dryads showed up at the elemental gates this morning; their mothers hovered nearby.  They were a bit worried that the children were leaving the nests so quickly, but it was hard to disagree that they had managed to outsmart the older troops.
map.hc3_main:7.town.49.43.0.event.1.desc: The elemental lords became suspicious of their own troops - an unexpected result of my raids.  They"ve been treating their units so badly lately that when I sent a few storm elementals up the driveway, they were joined by more elementals who had just deserted from the enemy armies.  Deserters joined my forces, and storm elementals destroyed the air lord"s supplies.
map.hc3_main:7.town.49.43.0.event.2.desc: As King Magnus promised, a small force of elementals arrived in exchange for stories about the elemental dimensions.
map.hc4_main:0.guards.0.34.0.message:
You come across a group of young centaurs practicing wrestling. They invite you to join.

When a human wrestles a centaur, he or she always starts from an underdog position due to the opponent"s weight and strength, but you have countless years of training behind you.  You defeat one youngster after another to finally become the ultimate winner.

Moments before your departure, the centuaries bring you a gift - a reward for this unparalleled display of strength.
map.hc4_main:0.guards.27.22.0.message:
You are hiding in the shade of the trees from the hot rays of the midday sun when suddenly a pair of strong arms surround you.  They squeeze the air from your lungs and effortlessly throw it into the air; you fall to the ground a few meters away.

When you get back on your feet, you see that the entire forest is moving.  The trees surround you and come furious to kill you!
map.hc4_main:0.guards.3.31.0.message:
You hear a whooshing sound, scream in pain and grab your arm.  Your tunic is torn and blood is flowing from underneath.  A few meters behind you, an arrow is stuck in the ground.

It"s only when you turn towards the nearby grove that you see the archers.  A group of elven dissenters have abandoned their camouflage and are attacking!
map.hc4_main:0.guards.35.30.0.message:
Known for their stoic nature, dwarves are not in the habit of playing carelessly, and when they do start playing, it"s always about the pledge.

By joining a group of axe-throwing dwarves, you pit your horse against the Shield of the Dwarven Lords.  The stocky dwarf throws first and hits a very close bull!  Worse still, the head of the ax covers the center of the shield - there"s no way you can win.

Gritting your teeth, you throw the ax with all your might and it splits the head in half, embedding itself in the middle.  To the dwarves" surprise, you win!
map.hc4_main:0.guards.6.21.0.message: As you turn towards the sound of the sound of hooves, you see a group of riders emerging from behind a small hill.  No, they"re not riders!  These are centaurs - a combination of man and horse; you know they are fiery warriors.  They look ready to attack.
map.hc4_main:0.monster.12.34.0.message: Stubborn, like all dwarves, the bandits refuse to move out of the way, nor do they want to listen to any arguments.
map.hc4_main:0.monster.30.2.0.message:
In front of you is the dragon whisperer"s house, but as you approach, you notice a group of angry green dragons roaming around in the garden.  They look like they"re going to destroy the house and kill the charmer.

As soon as you charged in with your sword drawn, you were overcome with regret.  Killing these beautiful creatures is evil, but you see no other option.
map.hc4_main:0.monster.6.26.0.message:
The centaurs guarding the sawmill from bandits beg you to let them join the search for the dragons.

As their leader explains, "We all fought alongside the dragons, and each of us owes a blood debt to them. If you don"t agree to take us, we will look for them anyway!"

Sometimes it"s very hard to say no to centaurs, so you recruit them into your ranks.
map.hc4_main:0.quest.32.1.0.completed:
Sit down, Tarnum.  The story I want to tell you is a long one.  Let me make some tea and tell you what I know about your enemies.  

First, I have a story for you about the Dragon Queen of Nighon...
map.hc4_main:0.quest.32.1.0.firstVisit:
Hello Tarnum!  The dragons have said many good things about you - they call you friend.  Few people deserved such respect from them; it"s no coincidence that you became their hero.

I fear for the good dragons, Tarnum.  They were dragged from their caves as if some invisible hand had grabbed them.  I saw in their eyes that they couldn"t resist it, even though they didn"t want to go.

You will need these battle unicorns to return safely to the elven king.  Tell him that on behalf of the dragons, I have chosen you to be their savior.  His covenant with the dragons obliges him to provide you with all possible help.
map.hc4_main:0.quest.32.1.0.nextVisit: You are not Tarnum.  Go away!
map.hc4_main:1.guards.24.29.0.message:
You were focused on steering your ship to safely avoid the reefs and the arrival of the winged women, who came from the direction of the caves high on the cliffs, took you completely by surprise.

"Harpies!" shouted the deckhand from the crow"s nest.

Unfortunately, he was the first victim of the attack - one of the harpies had already taken him to the nest.  The rest went on the attack - you have to defend yourself.
map.hc4_main:1.guards.25.23.0.message: Your ship sailed too close to the shore and was pelted with fireballs by magogs hiding on the shore.  The fire engulfed the stern of the ship, causing the loss of supplies before you could extinguish it.
map.hc4_main:1.guards.26.34.0.message:
You were driving past a group of dead trees when, to your surprise, an elf ran out onto the road.  More of his brethren followed him, all of them looking tired and dirty.

"I thought I"d never see a friendly face, but here you are!" said the elven archer.

"What are you doing here?" you ask.

"We were part of an expedition sent to search for a vial of dragon"s blood, but we were captured by demons and imprisoned. We were brought here to be tortured, but thanks to our captain, Valita, we managed to escape. Since then, we have been hiding while trying to find a way out of this place. cursed island!"

"You"re very lucky we stopped here," you replied.  "What happened to your captain?"

"I hope he"s dead," the elf replied sadly.  "She has been in a prison not far from here for months. The fiends who inhabit this island are masters of torture."

The elves happily joined you, hoping to take revenge on the creatures that imprisoned their leader.
map.hc4_main:1.monster.10.27.0.message: One of the scouts returns from the shipyard, reporting that a rebellious group of gray elves have taken control and are refusing to back down.  All attempts to bribe them were unsuccessful. You have no choice but to remove them by force.
map.hc4_main:1.monster.16.19.0.message:
The local dwarf told you that the gold mine has been abandoned for three months, since some huge dogs made it their lair.  All attempts by the miners to scare away the hellhounds were unsuccessful.  There were even fatalities.

You promise help in exchange for a constant supply of gold to supply your army.

"Agreed," said the miner dwarf.
map.hc4_main:1.monster.23.35.0.message:
The devil comes out of prison.  He cracks his whip, splitting a nearby boulder in half.  Immediately, a whole pack of his brethren appears around him.

"Run away, otherwise you will join the wretches rotting in our dungeons!" says the devil.
map.hc4_main:2.guards.15.12.0.message: The guardians of the shield of the cursed are ready to fight to the death to defend it.  They do not heed your persuasion and will not return the artifact.  Do you want to fight them for the shield?
map.hc4_main:2.guards.34.25.0.message:
The smoke from the burning fire drew your attention to this distant place. You notice a group of demons trying to hide among the trees.

They appear to be carrying some item of great power, perhaps for your enemies.  Do you want to attack?
map.hc4_main:2.monster.13.63.1.message:
You drop a drop of blood from the vial onto the head of each dragon mother.  One by one, they open their eyes and rise majestically to their full height.

"Thank you, Tarnum, Friend of Dragons! Mutare no longer has power over us!"
map.hc4_main:2.monster.15.62.1.message:
You drop a drop of blood from the vial onto the head of each dragon mother.  One by one, they open their eyes and rise majestically to their full height.

"Thank you, Tarnum, Friend of Dragons! Mutare no longer has power over us!"
map.hc4_main:2.monster.56.25.0.message: A flock of manticores peeks out from the shadows between the trees.  They surround a moss-covered statue with something gleaming on its neck.
map.hc4_main:2.monster.7.49.0.message: Several unicorns stand in the road as if they were guarding something precious.  They charge at you, giving you no time to explain that you are not going to fight them.
map.hc4_main:2.quest.72.52.0.completed:
The young man at the door smiles when he sees you.

"I see that you are worthy of the master"s teachings. Wait here, please."

The door closes, then immediately opens again, and the same young man with a fake white beard stands there.

"I"m ready to teach you my secrets," he says.

You try not to laugh at this man"s strange disguise.  Do you want to go into the hut?
map.hc4_main:2.quest.72.52.0.firstVisit:
At the door to the cottage you meet a young man who asks the reason for your visit.

"I want to talk to the sage who lives here," you reply.

"I"m sorry, but my master only teaches people of great Power and Knowledge. Come back when you are skilled enough."

And the young man politely closes the door.
map.hc4_main:2.quest.72.52.0.nextVisit: "I"m sorry," says the young adept, "but you are not yet skilled enough to see my master."
map.hc4_main:3.monster.19.23.0.message: Several red dragons torture young green dragons near the dragon caves by flying around the cave entrances and sweeping them with jets of fire.  The cubs trapped in the caves will not be free unless you kill the red dragons.
map.hc4_main:4.guards.12.5.0.message:
An elven spy who watches the Erathian border has scheduled a meeting for you here.  You"ve been waiting alone for an hour when a spy emerges from the shadows of nearby trees and approaches you.

"Hello, Tarnum," says the spy.  "I heard about your mission and I have something you might find useful."

The elf takes out a telescope from his backpack.

"I"ve been monitoring Erathian movements for decades with this device. You can borrow it if you want."

Will you accept the telescope?
map.hc4_main:4.guards.25.6.0.message:
A member of the Forest Guard, one of the elf king"s soldiers, emerges from the trees.  He opens his backpack and takes out a pair of shoes.

"This is for you," he says, "a gift from the king of the elves. He wishes to thank you for your service thus far and for completing the task you have undertaken."

When you took the shoes back, the elf bowed slightly and left without saying anything else.
map.hc4_main:5.guards.22.0.0.message: A group of cavalrymen guard the helm of the hellish storm, stubbornly sticking to the last order they were given - to defend the artifact to the last drop of blood.  Do you want to fight these dumb riders for the helm of the hell storm?
map.hc4_main:6.guards.21.63.0.message: You decide to eat your meal on an old, rotten log, but as you sit down, the wood collapses under your weight.  As you get up, you notice something glowing in the remains of the wood - someone"s long-forgotten treasure.
map.hc4_main:6.monster.63.60.0.message:
The fairy dragon circles above your head, looking excited.

"Thank you, thank you! We would have joined your side earlier if we had known that the blue ones would fight on the side of the Dragon Queen," he says.

"Yes, it"s sad. Everything is against us," you reply.

"Can we join you? And improve your chances a little, I guess!"
map.hc5_main:0.guards.2.31.0.message:
Up ahead you see an old battlefield.  The bones of fallen soldiers cover the ground, and the repulsive stench almost knocks you off your feet.  But wait!  One of the corpses moved!  He stands, brandishing a rust-eaten sword.

Then the next one gets up and the next ones get up.  It"s a trap!
map.hc5_main:1.monster.24.11.0.message: "Burn! Burn! Let the Tree of Life burn!" the mad skeletons cackle.  "Death to everything that lives!"
map.hc5_main:1.monster.29.12.0.message: "You come just in time! There used to be a lot of us here, but we have been fighting for a long time. Many have died. Some of our own even rose up and joined these terrible necromancers!" say the goblins.  They ask you to join them in your forces.
map.hc5_main:1.monster.31.18.0.message:
"We cordially invite you to empty this golden vein - after we empty your veins of blood!"

Vampires attack!
map.hc5_main:1.monster.34.10.0.message:
"Dead or Undead! Soon these will be the only choices!"

The skeletons draw their rusty swords and attack with maddening fury.
map.hc5_main:2.guards.19.7.1.message:
As you explore each cave, you hear the sound of a hammer hitting an anvil.  A group of cyclops are working to forge a magical tunic.  As you approach, they raise their rocks above their heads, glaring at you with hatred from their one eye.

"This tunic was made for the cyclops king, not for creatures like yours!" says one of them.

Will you fight to get the tunic?
map.hc5_main:2.guards.25.7.1.message:
A dove flies whistling above you, so close that you feel the gust of wind carried on its wings on your face.  You decide to follow the creature - a bird like the one in this maze must be a sign!

You soon lose sight of the dove, but you notice a shiny object inside a hollow log lying in the clearing.  You walk over and take the lucky statuette out of the trunk, thanking the bird for showing you the way.
map.hc5_main:3.guards.9.22.0.message: A horde of ogre deserters camps here, spending their time drinking and wrestling.  They attack anyone who accidentally approaches them.  You"ve heard that their loot includes the Cloak of Agility, but you"ll have to fight for it.  Do you want to attack the ogres?
map.hc5_main:4.guards.19.64.0.message: The head of a legionnaire, an important element of the legion"s statue, sticks out of a hole in the cave wall.  Extracting it won"t be difficult, but you have to watch out for the horde of liches stationed here.  Do you want to launch an attack on them?
map.hc5_main:4.guards.69.9.0.message:
An old woman sits in the middle of the road, holding a bag of gold in her hands.  She is blind, but she hears your footsteps and calls you.

"In exchange for a cozy place where I can spend the rest of my days, I offer you this bag," she says.

You summon some of your men and order them to take her to the nearest fortress and give her the most magnificent room.
map.hc5_main:4.guards.71.67.0.message:
As you approach the forest, you notice a pair of abandoned shoes.  Intrigued, you move closer, but then a horde of bony hands shoot out of the ground around you.  The skeletons dig themselves out, standing around the shoes.  Looks like you won"t get them without a fight.

Do you want to fight a battle with skeletons?
map.hc6_main:0.guards.1.33.0.message: It takes a moment for your eyes to adjust to the daylight, something you haven"t seen in months. The air is hot and dry and the sun burns your skin. You feel good.
map.hc6_main:1.town.33.3.0.name: Blackdome
map.hc6_main:2.town.2.34.1.name: safeguard
map.hc6_main:3.heroes.154.name: Ancestor
map.hc6_main:4.heroes.155.biography: Once one of the nameless Ancestors, Vorr allowed the brutality and hatred of a barbarian tribe seeking a god of war to corrupt him. Now he is a madman, obsessed with destroying the world.
map.hc6_main:4.heroes.155.name: Vorre
map.hc6_main:4.monster.27.54.0.message: A group of firebirds circles the area. Under them there are carts abandoned by drivers. You notice that one of them is a self-filling log cart. As you approach, the firebirds attack!
map.hc6_main:4.town.70.44.0.event.0.desc:
I couldn"t believe it when I saw Skizzik at the head of a small group of soldiers. I thought the familiar was dead, but it came towards me, its shiny hoe slung over its shoulder.

"I thought you were dead," said Skizzik.

"We thought you were dead," I replied.

"Mine to die" replied Skizzik. "It makes me twice dead, but they can kill me - it makes me stronger!"

I took my familiar"s hand and shook it. It"s good to see a friend again.

"Where have you been?"
